content.body: Urgh. Just noticed another problem in CreateListFromArrayLike: the sentence `_elementTypes_ contains the names of ECMAScript Language Types that are allowed for element values of the List that is created.` Should instead be saying something about `_validElementTypes_`.
content.formatted_body: Urgh. Just noticed another problem in CreateListFromArrayLike: the sentence _elementTypes_ contains the names of ECMAScript Language Types that are allowed for element values of the List that is created. Should instead be saying something about _validElementTypes_.

content.body: I've added code to ecmaspeak to detect when an algorithm description mentions an alias that isn't a parameter. It found a bunch of cases, but most are reasonable. One that's questionable is in ValidateAndApplyPropertyDescriptor, which has a parameter _extensible_, but the description refers to it via _extensibility_ (which certainly reads better in context).
content.formatted_body: I've added code to ecmaspeak to detect when an algorithm description mentions an alias that isn't a parameter. It found a bunch of cases, but most are reasonable. One that's questionable is in ValidateAndApplyPropertyDescriptor, which has a parameter extensible, but the description refers to it via extensibility (which certainly reads better in context).
